lines.line: Hmmph. What do you want?
I was just wondering what was down those stairs?
You can't go down there!
I didn't want to anyway.
Good. Because you can't.
Because I don't want to.
Because you can't. So that's fine.
Yes, it is.
Yes. Fine.
Absolutely.
Well then.
Why not?
This is the home of the Mountain Dwarves. How would you like it if I wanted to take a shortcut through your home?
Ooh... is this a shortcut to somewhere?
Well, it is a lot easier to go this way to get past White Wolf Mountain than through those wolf filled passes.
Oh, sorry, I hadn't realised it was private.
Well, it is.
If you were my friend I wouldn't mind.
Yes, but I don't even know you.
Well, let's be friends!
I'd rather not, thank you.
And how am I meant to do that?
My, we are the persistent one aren't we?
Well, there's a certain gold artefact we're after. We dwarves are big fans of gold! This artefact is the first prize at the Hemenster fishing competition.
Fortunately we have acquired a pass to enter that competition...
Unfortunately Dwarves don't make good fishermen.
Fortunately I'm alright at fishing!
Okay. I entrust you with our competition pass. Don't forget to take some gold with you for the entrance fee.
Go to Hemenster and do us proud!
You're a grumpy little man aren't you?
Don't you know it.
I'm bigger than you. Let me by!
...stumpy.
Go away! You're not going to bully your way in HERE!
I was just stopping to say hello!
Hello then.
Do you have a brother?
What if I do! It's no business of yours.
Hmmph. What do you want?
You can't go down there!
Good. Because you can't.
Because you can't. So that's fine.
Yes. Fine.
Well then.
This is the home of the Mountain Dwarves. How would you like it if I wanted to take a shortcut through your home?
Well, it is a lot easier to go this way to get past White Wolf Mountain than through those wolf filled passes.
Well, it is.
Yes, but I don't even know you.
I'd rather not, thank you.
My, we are the persistent one aren't we?
Well, there's a certain gold artefact we're after. We dwarves are big fans of gold! This artefact is the first prize at the Hemenster fishing competition.
Fortunately we have acquired a pass to enter that competition...
Unfortunately Dwarves don't make good fishermen.
Okay. I entrust you with our competition pass. Don't forget to take some gold with you for the entrance fee.
Go to Hemenster and do us proud!
Don't you know it.
Go away! You're not going to bully your way in HERE!
Hello then.
What if I do! It's no business of yours.
Have you won yet?
No, not yet.
Well don't give up! Maybe old Jack can give you a few tips.
Have you won yet?
Well don't give up! Maybe old Jack can give you a few tips.
I need another competition pass.
Hmmm. It's a good job they sent us spares.
There you go. Try not to lose that one.
No, it takes preparation to win fishing competitions.
Maybe that's where we are going wrong when we try fishing?
Probably.
Maybe we should talk to that old Jack fella near the competition, everyone seemed to be ranting about him.
Hmmm. It's a good job they sent us spares.
There you go. Try not to lose that one.
Maybe that's where we are going wrong when we try fishing?
Maybe we should talk to that old Jack fella near the competition, everyone seemed to be ranting about him.
What are you sitting around here for?
I'm making sure only those with a competition pass enter the fishing contest.
I have one here.
Move on through. Talk to Bonzo to enter the competition.
Competition pass please.
Who are you?
My name iz Vlad. I come from far avay, vere the sun iz not so bright.
You're a vampyre aren't you?
Just because I can't stand ze smell ov garlic und I don't like bright sunlight doesn't necessarily mean I'm ein vampyre!
Is it nice there?
It is vonderful! Ze vomen are beautiful und ze nights are long!
Well, good luck with the fishing.
Luck haz notsing to do vith it it is all in ze technique.
So... you like fishing?
My doctor told me to take up ein velaxing hobby. Vhen I am stressed I tend to get ein little..
..thirsty.
If you get thirsty you should drink something.
I tsink I may do zat soon...
Hey guy! Always nice to see a fresh face!
So you're the champ?
That's right, guy! Ain't nobody better at fishing round here than me! That's for sure!
Can I fish here instead of you?
Sorry guy! This is my lucky spot!
Do you have any tips for me?
Why would I help you? I wanna stay the best! I'm not givin' away my secrets like old Grampa Jack does!
Who's Grampa Jack?
You really have no clue do you! He won this competition four years in a row! He lives in the house just outside the gate.
Yeah? What you want?
Um... nothing really...
Quit bugging me then! I got me some fish to catch!
Nuh uh dude. Less talk, more fishing!
Dude! Why should I help you? You like, might beat me! I'm not giving away my secrets like that dude Grampa Jack does!
Who's Grampa Jack ! He won this competition four years in a row! He lives in the house just outside the gate.
Hello young man! Come to visit old Grandpa Jack? I can tell ye stories for sure. I used to be the best fisherman these parts have seen!
Tell me a story then.
Well, when I were a young man we used to take fishing trips over to Catherby; The fishing over there - now that was something!
Anyway, we decided to do a bit of fishing with our nets, I wasn't having the best of days turning up nothing but old boots and bits of seaweed. Then my net suddenly got really heavy!
To my amazement I'd caught this little chest thing!
Are you entering the fishing competition?
Ah... the Hemenster fishing competition...
I know all about that... I won that four years straight! I'm too old for that lark now though...
I don't suppose you could give me any hints?
Well, you sometimes get these really big fish in the water just by the outflow pipes.
I think they're some kind of carp...
I used to get those from McGrubor's wood, north of here. Just dig around in the red vines up there but be careful of the guard dogs.
There's this weird creepy guy who says he's not a vampyre using that spot. He keeps winning too.

Ahh well, I'm sure you'll find something to put him off. After all, there must be a kitchen around here with some garlic in it, perhaps in Seers Village or Ardougne. If he's pretending to be a vampyre then he can pretend to be scared of garlic!
You're right! Thanks Jack!
That's less competition for me then.
Why you young whippersnapper! If I was twenty years younger I'd show you something that's for sure!
Sorry, I don't have time now.
Sigh...
Young people - always in such a rush.
Can I buy one of your fishing rods?
But young man, you have your own. I'll not sell you mine when you already have one!
I've forgotten how to fish, can you remind me?
Of course! Let me see now...You'll need a rod and bait. You can fish with a net too, but not in the competition.
Ok... I think I can get those at Catherby.

Then simply find yourself a fishing spot, either in the competition near here, or wherever you can - I recommend net fishing in Catherby. Net or Lure the fish in the fishing spot by clicking on it and then be
patient...
It's that simple?
Yep! Go get em tiger.
Hey, you need to pay to enter the competition first! Only 5 gp entrance fee!
Roll up, roll up!
Enter the great Hemenster fishing competition!
Only 5gp entrance fee!
I'll enter the competition please.
Ok, nearly everyone is in their place already. You fish in the spot by the willow tree, and the Sinister Stranger, you fish by the pipes.
Arrgh! WHAT is that GHASTLY smell??? I think I will move over here instead...
Hmm. You'd better go and take the area by the pipes then.
No thanks, I'll just watch the fun.
Ok, we've got all the fishermen! It's time to roll!
You've already paid, you don't need to pay me again!
Ewww - it's a smelly sewage pipe.
So you're calling it quits here for now?
Yes I'll compete again another day.
Ok, I'll see you again.
Actually I'll go back and catch some more.
Good luck!
So how are you doing so far?
I caught some fish! Here...
And the winner is... The stranger in black!
I have this big fish.
Is it enough to win?
Well, we'll just wait till time is up.
We have a new winner! The heroic-looking person who was fishing by the pipes has caught the biggest carp I've seen since Grandpa Jack used to compete!
I think I might still be able to find a bigger fish.
Ok, good luck!
Hello champ!
I don't feel like a champ...
Why not champ?
I lost my fishing trophy...
Is that all chump? Don't worry, I have a spare!
So any hints on how to fish?
I think I'll keep them to myself.
Yes I have!
Well done! That's brilliant! Do you have the trophy with you?
Yep, I have it right here!
Oh! It's even more shiny and gold than I thought possible...
You've done us proud. Thank you. I think we can now trust you enough to let you in...
In where?
Why the tunnel of course! You may now come and go freely, avoiding the wolves and dangers of the cold, high mountain. You could even stop in for a beer or two!
Excellent. That will come in most handy.
Well done! That's brilliant! Do you have the trophy with you?
Oh! It's even more shiny and gold than I thought possible...
Welcome, oh great Fishing Champion! Feel free to pop by and use our tunnel any time.
Thank you, I think I'll stop by for a beer one day.

characters.name: Austri
characters.description: Middle-aged male dwarf, Scottish accent, gruff and grumpy tone, a stern guard who is protective of his mountain home and distrustful of outsiders.

characters.name: Big Dave
characters.description: Middle-aged male, working-class British accent, boastful and competitive tone, a large imposing fisherman who is proud of his champion status and protective of his lucky fishing spot.

characters.name: Bonzo
characters.description: Middle-aged male, enthusiastic carnival barker style, cheerful and energetic tone, a fair-minded contest judge who enjoys announcing and running the fishing competition.

characters.name: Grandpa Jack
characters.description: Elderly male, warm British accent, nostalgic and friendly tone, a retired fishing champion who loves sharing stories and tips with younger adventurers.

characters.name: Joshua
characters.description: Young adult male, laid-back surfer-style accent, casual and friendly tone, a relaxed fisherman who uses words like 'dude' and has a carefree attitude.

characters.name: Morris
characters.description: Middle-aged male, formal British accent, matter-of-fact and professional tone, a no-nonsense gatekeeper who takes his job of checking competition passes seriously.

characters.name: Sinister Stranger
characters.description: Adult male vampyre, thick Eastern European accent, mysterious and theatrical tone, speaks with heavy 'v' and 'z' sounds while unconvincingly denying being a vampyre.

characters.name: Vestri
characters.description: Middle-aged male dwarf, Scottish accent, gruff and grumpy tone, a stern guard who is protective of his mountain home and distrustful of outsiders.
